xml.metadata:
xnbData: target: "w" compressed: true hiDef: true readerData: - type: "Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.DictionaryReader`2[[System.String, mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089],[System.String, mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089]]" version: 0
- type: "Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.StringReader" version: 0
numSharedResources: 0
content: #!Dictionary<String,String>
xml.p: Rainy_Day_0: "I wonder where the flying insects go when it rains? Don't they get hit by the raindrops?" #!String
Rainy_Day_1: "A day like this is a blessing from mother nature." #!String
Rainy_Day_2: "Good morning... I got this gift for you. Don't worry, I already purified it with sage incense. [428 440 444 338 207]" #!String
Rainy_Day_3: "I meant to let the parrot go free, but his wing never fully healed. He seems content, though. I give him lots of attention.#$e#He told me that he's happy here." #!String
Rainy_Day_4: "I never told you this... but when you first moved here I had a dream about you. I knew right then that our life-paths would intertwine.$4" #!String
Rainy_Night_0: "Every moment has a unique and precious beauty... do you notice? It can be easy to forget, sometimes." #!String
patio_Emily: "This is my favorite spot for a morning meditation.#$e#I visualize the energy from this crystal garden flowing through my body." #!String
Rainy_Night_1: "I can hear the plants talking to each other... they're so happy after today's rain!" #!String
Rainy_Night_2: "How was your day, @? You look a little soggy." #!String
Rainy_Night_3: "My day was very peaceful. How was yours?" #!String
Rainy_Night_4: "Want some dessert? It's my special raw, gluten-free version, sweetened only with cactus syrup.[232 234 223 220]$h" #!String
Rainy_Night_5: "Does the sound of rain ever put you in a trance?" #!String
Indoor_Day_0: "Another beautiful day on %farm farm... I have faith that something good will happen today!$h" #!String
Indoor_Day_1: "Here, take this. It's for you. [428 440 444 338 207 395 749]" #!String
Indoor_Day_2: "Hey, someone must've gotten a good night of sleep... you look fresh this morning.$h" #!String
Indoor_Day_3: "My horoscope for the day isn't too good... but I'm going to make the best of it, as always. Let's get to work!" #!String
Indoor_Day_4: "Ughh... *gurgle*... I ate too many bran muffins for breakfast.$s" #!String
Indoor_Night_0: "Is that a new hole I see in your shirt? I can sew that up for you, no problem." #!String
Indoor_Night_1: "Welcome home, @. I hope you had a wonderful day." #!String
Indoor_Night_2: "Is it bed time already? My, the day just floated away from me again.$u" #!String
Indoor_Night_3: "Ah, that aroma! It can only be you.$h#$e#It's a good smell." #!String
Indoor_Night_4: "I swept the whole house, washed the windows, dusted, and cleaned the fridge. It was a very productive day!" #!String
Outdoor_0: "I love getting up early. There's a certain freshness to the air and the wildlife is much more active." #!String
Outdoor_1: "What's on the agenda today, dear?" #!String
Outdoor_2: "Oooh! Ooh! I saw another one!$h#$e#I'm counting squirrels." #!String
Outdoor_3: "A little sunlight is good for you. Just don't get crispy, okay?" #!String
Outdoor_4: "Good morning! I was wondering when you'd finally roll out of bed!$h#$e#It's okay, @... you deserve a good night of rest." #!String
OneKid_0: "I hope we can raise %kid1 to be kind and considerate. That's more important than getting A's in school." #!String
OneKid_1: "Is one child enough, or should we raise another?#$e#I guess we'll just see where fate leads us." #!String
OneKid_3: "I lit a pale green candle and shook a sprig of baby-mint over %kid1. That should ward off any dangerous spirits." #!String
TwoKids_1: "A big house, two kids and a parrot... I have my hands full!" #!String
TwoKids_2: "Well, %kid2 certainly has your hair...$u" #!String
TwoKids_3: "Oh, I already fed the kids their organic quinoa puffs with goat milk. You just focus on the farm!" #!String
Good_1: "This is so fun to live together! I always thought I'd be single my whole life." #!String
Good_2: "It was our destiny to be together... I believe that with all my heart!" #!String
Good_3: "Thanks for taking me into your home. I love this new life.$4" #!String
Good_4: "Our vibrational energies are perfectly in tune. Can't you feel it?" #!String
Good_5: "I was just admiring my wedding amulet... The shell is beautiful! I can feel the pure blue energy radiating from it.$l" #!String

Good_6: "I had another dream about us last night. We had climbed to the top of a crystal tree, looking down on the most lush and beautiful meadow. I keep having this dream.#$e#I don't know what it means, but I feel that it's a good omen." #!String
Neutral_0: "I hope you'll still like me when I grow old and my hair turns to a dull, faded steel." #!String
Neutral_8: "I feel uninspired today.$s" #!String
funLeave_Emily: "I'm going to visit town today, and later on I'm going to help out at the saloon. Have a nice day." #!String
funReturn_Emily: "My day went well... it's good to get out of the house now and then." #!String
spring_2: "My friends, the plants, have come back to life. I feel content." #!String
spring_1: "Happy new year, honey. Let's make this a special one.$4" #!String
spring_22: "Hmm... I'm thinking maybe a salad of fresh foraged greens for dinner tonight?" #!String
summer_20: "The energy in our bodies fluctuate just as the seasons do. Understanding your own unique rhythym is the first step to inner harmony." #!String
summer_2: "May Yoba bless you on this lovely day.$7" #!String
fall_1: "The year's already half-way over. Can you believe it?" #!String

fall_25: "Our bodies are naturally in tune with the seasons. This light and color of fall compels us to prepare for the barren winter.#$e#To our distant ancestors, this feeling was encompassing and vital. For us, it only barely peeks through the noise of modern life." #!String
winter_15: "On a day like this, I have a craving for cinnamon, nutmeg, clove, and cardamom." #!String
winter_5: "*sigh*... Why does there have to be war and hatred in the world?$s" #!String
winter_2: "I can't help but think of all the poor, frozen squirrels out there right now.$s" #!String
spring_Maru: "I'm feeling excited for a new year of farming, @!$h" #!String
fall_Emily: "I drank a super-food smoothie this morning and I feel aaah-mazing!$h" #!String
summer_Emily: "Phew! It's hot but it feels great, doesn't it?#$e#Maybe we'll see some wild parrots today." #!String
winter_Emily: "Whoops, my hair is frozen solid again.$s" #!String
spouseRoom_Emily: "I'm going to spend some time with the parrot today. It breaks my heart that he'll never fly again.$u" #!String
